articles.title: ES.Next / ES6 Needs You!

snippet.text: Twitter's Angus Croll puts out a call to all JavaScript developers to help the TC39 technical committee get a gauge on developer opinion through his 'JS Fixed' project

articles.title: Node.js HTTP Server Security Vulnerability: Upgrade to 0.6.17

snippet.text: A carefully crafted attack request can cause the contents of the HTTP parser's buffer to be appended to the attacking request's header, making it appear to come from the attacker. The short story is.. upgrade Node or apply a fix offered within

articles.title: How To Build A Real-Time Commenting System

snippet.text: A comprehensive tutorial by Phil Leggetter that walks through building a real-time commenting system using PHP, JavaScript, and the Pusher WebSocket hosted service

articles.title: Roll Your Own Drag-and-Drop Handling (With Help From jQuery UI)

snippet.text: In this tutorial Jo Liss shows how to create your own low-level drag-and-drop handler with jQuery UI's Mouse plugin

articles.title: Proxies and Frozen Objects in ES6

snippet.text: Tom Van Cutsem explains how 'frozen' JavaScript objects will interact with the forthcoming Proxy API. More interesting than it sounds - honest

articles.title: Multi-Server Continuous Deployment with 'Fleet'

snippet.text: Fleet makes it easy for anyone on your team to push new code from a git repo to a wide number of servers and then manage all the processes in your stack. James Halliday shows us how, using Node server processes

articles.title: Learning Three.js: A tQuery plugin for Rendering and Using DOOM Characters
PL/v8 + CoffeeScript: CoffeeScript as a PostgreSQL Function Language?

snippet.text: PL/v8 is an ongoing project to allow the use of JavaScript as a scripting language within the PostgreSQL database engine. Here, Hitoshi Harada experiments with bringing CoffeeScript into the mix too

articles.title: Problems With a 'Pure Javascript' Implementation of H.264
Allen Wirfs-Brock on JavaScript Today and Tomorrow

snippet.text: JavaScript guru and Mozilla Research Fellow Allen Wirfs-Brock reviews the evolution of JavaScript, observing its current status and foreseeing its near future. Allen really knows his stuff and this is well worth watching

articles.title: Addy Osmani's JavaScript Jabber: Design Patterns in Javascript

snippet.text: The always excellent JavaScript Jabber podcast invited Addy Osmani in for a chat about design patterns. They covered a ton in 45 minutes and even the show notes alone are a handy repository of links to structural libraries and frameworks

articles.title: How JS Works and the Firefox Debugger API

snippet.text: A 9 minute lightning talk given at Mozilla Toronto by Jim Blandy where he talks about how JavaScript programs work behind the scenes, explains how the new Firefox Debugger API works, and then shows it in action

articles.title: O'Reilly Radar: The Surprising Rise of JavaScript

snippet.text: A video interview with me on the O'Reilly Radar blog in my capacity as O'Reilly Fluent co-chair, as well as Steve Souders talking about Web performance tools

articles.title: Stats.js Updated; Now Themeable with CSS

snippet.text: Stats.js is a JavaScript performance monitoring box that's popular in the JavaScript graphics, demo, and game development scenes. It has just been updated with CSS theming support and the ability to select a default mode

articles.title: YUIDoc 0.3.0 Released: A Documentation Generation App

snippet.text: YUIDoc is a JavaScript documentation generator that runs as a Node.js app and generates documentation from comments in source. It was built for use with the YUI project but can be used on other codebases easily

articles.title: jQuery Knob: Simple and Effective Dial Controls (using Canvas)
NodObjC: A Node.js to Objective C Bridge

snippet.text: NodObjC is a bridge between Node.js and the Objective C runtime and frameworks, making it possible to write native Cocoa applications using Node.js

articles.title: Dynamo.js: Dynamic 'Rotating' Text Elements in Your Content

snippet.text: Hard to explain but Dynamo makes it easy to have certain bits of text on your page 'cycle' through various options. The effect is subtle and simple and worth checking out

articles.title: EpicEditor: Embeddable JavaScript Markdown Editor

snippet.text: Embeddable JavaScript Markdown editor which includes automatic link creation and code fencing. First mentioned in JSW #68 but it has had some updates and upgrades

articles.title: BitSyntax-JS: Binary Data Pattern Matching for Node.js
node-webcl: Khronos WebCL Implementation for Node.js

snippet.text: Want to do computations on the GPU from JavaScript? You can with WebCL and this implementation brings WebCL (and so OpenCL) functionality to Node

articles.title: sm.js: Communicate with SpiderMonkey from Node.js
node-webgl: A Port of WebGL to the Desktop (via Node.js)
Vert.x: JVM-based Polyglot Async App Development (Alternative To Node.js?)
Wolfenstein 3D in the Browser

snippet.text: To celebrate the 20 year anniversary of seminal first person shooter Wolfenstein 3D, Bethesda Softworks has made a JavaScript port - you can play it right now. Interestingly, it doesn't use Canvas, etc, but a lot of CSS and DOM manipulation
